title: Starlake Data Pipeline
description: JSON Schema for Starlake Data Pipeline

oneOf.description: Any string that match the '.*' regex

Any whole number that match the '[-|+|0-9][0-9]*' regex.
ints are mapped to as 'int' in some database whereas 'longs are mapped as 'bigint' and shorts as 'smallint'

Any whole number that match the '[-|+|0-9][0-9]*' regex.
ints are mapped to as 'int' in some database whereas 'longs are mapped as 'bigint' and shorts as 'smallint'

Any whole number that match the '[-|+|0-9][0-9]*' regex.
ints are mapped to as 'int' in some database whereas 'longs are mapped as 'bigint' and shorts as 'smallint'
Any decimal number that match the '[-+]?\d*\.?\d+[Ee]?[-+]?\d*' regex

Any string that match the '(?i)true|yes|[y1]<-TF->(?i)false|no|[n0]' regex,
where the value on the left of '<-T' represent true and values on the right of 'F->' represent the false
Any date that match the 'yyyy-MM-dd' regex (2023-12-31)

date/time that match the 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss' regex s (2019-12-31 23:59:02).
For epoch timestamp, set pattern attribute to 'epoch_second' or 'epoch_milli'
Any floating value that match the '-?\d*\.{0,1}\d+' regex
Semi structured data type eq. JSON / XML
Any attribute that has children. Set the array to true if this attribute is made of a list of attributes

TrimV1.description: How to trim the input string

oneOf.description: Remove all leading space chars from the input
Remove all trailing spaces from the input
Remove all leading and trailing spaces from the input
Do not remove leading or trailing spaces from the input

TableDdlV1.description: DDL used to create a table

pingSql.description:
How to test if the table exist.
Use the following statement by default: 'select count(*) from tableName where 1=0'

selectSql.description: Override the default select defined by Starlake

Materialization.description: Table types supported by the Sink option

TableTypeBase.description: Table types supported by the Extract module

TableTypeV1.description: Table types supported by the Extract module

TypeV1.description: Custom type definition. Custom types are defined in the types/types.sl.yml file

pattern.description: Regex used to validate the input field

primitiveType.description:
To what primitive type should this type be mapped.
 This is the memory representation of the type, When saving, this primitive type is mapped to the database specific type. Default: string

zone.description:
useful when parsing specific string:
 - double: To parse a french decimal (comma as decimal separator) set it to fr_FR locale.
- decimal: to set the precision and scale of this number, '38,9' by default.
-

sample.description: This field makes sure that the pattern matches the value you want to match. This will be checked on startup

ddlMapping.description: Configure here the type mapping for each datawarehouse.\nWill be used when inferring DDL from schema.

PositionV1.description: First and last char positions of an attribute in a fixed length record

first.description: Zero based position of the first character for this attribute

last.description: Zero based position of the last character to include in this attribute

sparkFormat.description: Set only if you want to use the Spark engine

quote.description: Set only if you want to use the Spark engine

separator.description: Set only if you want to use the Spark engine

template.description: Dag template to use for this config. Usually a .py.j2 file

filename.description: {schedule}, {domain}, {table} in the file name are used for DAG generation purposes

RowLevelSecurityV1.description: Row level security policy to apply to the output data.

name.description: This Row Level Security unique name

predicate.description: The condition that goes to the WHERE clause and limit the visible rows.

grants.description:
user / groups / service accounts to which this security level is applied.
ex : user:me@mycompany.com,group:group@mycompany.com,serviceAccount:mysa@google-accounts.com

AccessControlEntryV1.description: Column level security policy to apply to the attribute.

role.description: This role to give to the granted users

grants.description:
user / groups / service accounts to which this security level is applied.
ex : user:me@mycompany.com,group:group@mycompany.com,serviceAccount:mysa@google-accounts.com

FormatV1.description:
DSV by default. Supported file formats are :
- DSV : Delimiter-separated values file. Delimiter value is specified in the "separator" field.
- POSITION : FIXED format file where values are located at an exact position in each line.
- JSON_FLAT : For optimisation purpose, we differentiate JSON with top level values from JSON
  with deep level fields. JSON_FLAT are JSON files with top level fields only.
- JSON :  Deep JSON file. Use only when your json documents contain sub-documents, otherwise prefer to
  use JSON_FLAT since it is much faster.
- XML : XML files

oneOf.description: any single or multiple character delimited file. Separator is specified in the separator field
any fixed position file. Positions are specified in the position field

any deep json file.
To improve performance, prefer the JSON_FLAT format if your json documents are flat
any json file containing an array of json objects.

any flat json file.
To improve performance, prefer this format if your json documents are flat
any xml file. Use the metadata.xml.rowTag field to specify the root tag of your xml file

tables.description:
List of all SQL create statements used to create audit tables for this JDBC engine.
Tables are created only if the execution of the pingSQL statement fails

options.description:
Privacy strategies. The following default strategies are defined by default:
- none: Leave the data as is
- hide: replace the data with an empty string
- hideX("s", n): replace the string with n occurrences of the string 's'
- md5: Redact the data using the MD5 algorithm
- sha1: Redact the data using the SHA1 algorithm
- sha256: Redact the data using the SHA256 algorithm
 - sha512: Redact the data using the SHA512 algorithm
- initials: keep only the first char of each word in the data

cacheStorageLevel.description:
How the RDD are cached. Default is MEMORY_AND_DISK_SER.
Available options are (https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/java/index.html?org/apache/spark/storage/StorageLevel.html):
- MEMORY_ONLY
- MEMORY_AND_DISK
- MEMORY_ONLY_SER
- MEMORY_AND_DISK_SER
- DISK_ONLY
- OFF_HEAP

intermediateBigqueryFormat.description:
May be parquet or ORC. Default is parquet. Used for BigQuery intermediate storage. Use ORC for for JSON files to keep the original data structure.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53674838/spark-writing-parquet-arraystring-converts-to-a-different-datatype-when-loadin

temporaryGcsBucket.description: The GCS bucket that temporarily holds the data before it is loaded to BigQuery.

location.description: GCP project location. Required if apply is true.

database.description: GCP Project id. Required if apply is true.

taxonomy.description: Taxonomy name. Required if apply is true.

maxJobs.description: Max number of Spark jobs to run in parallel, default is 1

poolName.description: Pool name to use for Spark jobs, default is 'default'

mode.description: This can be FIFO or FAIR, to control whether jobs within the pool queue up behind each other (the default) or share the pool’s resources fairly.

file.description: Scheduler filename in the metadata folder. If not set, defaults to fairscheduler.xml.

path.description: When using filesystem storage, the path to the expectations file

failOnError.description: should load / transform fail on expectation error ?

path.description: When using filesystem storage, the path to the metrics file

discreteMaxCardinality.description: Max number of unique values accepted for a discrete column. Default is 10

clustering.description: FS or BQ: List of attributes to use for clustering

days.description: BQ: Number of days before this table is set as expired and deleted. Never by default.

requirePartitionFilter.description: BQ: Should be require a partition filter on every request ? No by default.

materializedView.description: Should we materialize as a table or as a view when saving the results ? TABLE by default.

enableRefresh.description: BQ: Enable automatic refresh of materialized view ? false by default.

refreshIntervalMs.description: BQ: Refresh interval in milliseconds. Default to BigQuery default value

id.description: ES: Attribute to use as id of the document. Generated by Elasticsearch if not specified.

partition.description: FS or BQ: List of partition attributes

coalesce.description: When outputting files, should we coalesce it to a single file. Useful when CSV is the output format.

path.description: Optional path attribute if you want to save the file outside of the default location (datasets folder)

WriteStrategyTypeV1.description: Table types supported by the Extract module

OpenWriteStrategyTypeV1.description: Table types supported by the Extract module

multiline.description: are json objects on a single line or multiple line ? Single by default.  false means single. false also means faster

array.description: Is the json stored as a single object array ? false by default. This means that by default we have on json document per line.

withHeader.description: does the dataset has a header ? true by default

separator.description: the values delimiter,  ';' by default value may be a multichar string starting from Spark3

quote.description: The String quote char, '"' by default

ignore.description: Pattern to ignore or UDF to apply to ignore some lines

directory.description:
Folder on the local filesystem where incoming files are stored.
 Typically, this folder will be scanned periodically to move the dataset to the cluster for ingestion.
                     Files located in this folder are moved to the stage folder for ingestion by the "import" command.

extensions.description:
recognized filename extensions. json, csv, dsv, psv are recognized by default.
Only files with these extensions will be moved to the stage folder.

ack.description:
Ack extension used for each file. ".ack" if not specified.
Files are moved to the stage folder only once a file with the same name as the source file and with this extension is present.
To move a file without requiring an ack file to be present, set explicitly this property to the empty string value "".

options.description: Options to add to the spark reader

loader.description: Loader to use, 'spark' or 'native'. Default to 'spark' of SL_LOADER env variable is set to 'native'

emptyIsNull.description: Treat empty columns as null in DSV files. Default to false

dagRef.description: Cron expression to use for this domain/table

freshness.description: Configure freshness checks on this dataset

nullValue.description: Treat a specific input string as a null value indicator

schedule.description: Cron expression to use for this domain/table

stage.description: Files recognized by the extensions property are moved to this folder for ingestion by the "import" command.

unresolved.description: Files that cannot be ingested (do not match by any table pattern) are moved to this folder.

archive.description: Files that have been ingested are moved to this folder if SL_ARCHIVE is set to true.

ingesting.description: Files that are being ingested are moved to this folder.

replay.description: Invalid records are stored in this folder in source format when SL_SINK_REPLAY_TO_FILE is set to true.

warn.description: How old may be the data before a warning is raised. Use syntax like '3 day' or '2 hour' or '30 minute'

error.description: How old may be the data before an error is raised. Use syntax like '3 day' or '2 hour' or '30 minute'

name.description:
Schema name, must be unique among all the schemas belonging to the same domain.
  *                     Will become the hive table name On Premise or BigQuery Table name on GCP.

pattern.description:
filename pattern to which this schema must be applied.
  *                     This instructs the framework to use this schema to parse any file with a filename that match this pattern.

tags.description: Set of string to attach to this Schema

rls.description: Row level security on this schema.

expectations.description: Expectations to check after Load / Transform has succeeded

primaryKey.description: List of columns that make up the primary key

rename.description: If present, the table is renamed with this name. Useful when use in conjunction with the 'extract' module

sample.description: Store here a couple of records illustrating the table data.

filter.description: remove all records that do not match this condition

patternSample.description: Sample of filename matching this schema

name.description: Attribute name as defined in the source dataset and as received in the file

type.description: semantic type of the attribute. Default to string

required.description: Should this attribute always be present in the source. Default to true.

privacy.description: Should this attribute be applied a privacy transformation at ingestion time

rename.description: If present, the attribute is renamed with this name

metricType.description: If present, what kind of stat should be computed for this field

attributes.description: List of sub-attributes (valid for JSON and XML files only)

default.description: Default value for this attribute when it is not present.

script.description: Scripted field : SQL request on renamed column

foreignKey.description: If this attribute is a foreign key, reference to [domain.]table[.attribute]

ignore.description: Should this attribute be ignored on ingestion. Default to false

accessPolicy.description: Policy tag to assign to this attribute. Used for column level security

name.description: Main SQL request to execute (do not forget to prefix table names with the database name to avoid conflicts)

sql.description: Main SQL request to execute (do not forget to prefix table names with the database name to avoid conflicts)

database.description: Output Database (refer to a project id in BigQuery). Default to SL_DATABASE env var if set.

domain.description: Output domain in output Area (Will be the Database name in Hive or Dataset in BigQuery)

table.description: Dataset Name in output Area (Will be the Table name in Hive & BigQuery)

partition.description: List of columns used for partitioning the output.

presql.description: List of SQL requests to executed before the main SQL request is run

postsql.description: List of SQL requests to executed after the main SQL request is run

expectations.description: Expectations to check after Load / Transform has succeeded

freshness.description: Configure freshness checks on the output table

python.description: Python script URI to execute instead of the SQL request

tags.description: Set of string to attach to the output table

schedule.description: Cron expression to use for this task

dagRef.description: Cron expression to use for this domain/table

taskTimeoutMs.description: Number of milliseconds before a communication timeout.

parseSQL.description: Should we parse this SQL make it update the table according to write strategy or just execute it ?

connectionRef.description: Used when the default connection ref present in the application.sl.yml file is not the one to use to run the SQL request for this task.

path.description: Main SQL request to execute (do not forget to prefix table names with the database name to avoid conflicts)

sink.description: Output Database (refer to a project id in BigQuery). Default to SL_DATABASE env var if set.

maxErrors.description: Output domain in output Area (Will be the Database name in Hive or Dataset in BigQuery)

database.description: Dataset Name in output Area (Will be the Table name in Hive & BigQuery)

accessPolicy.description: Access policy to apply to this column

DomainV1.description: A schema in JDBC database or a folder in HDFS or a dataset in BigQuery.

name.description:
Domain name. Make sure you use a name that may be used as a folder name on the target storage.
                   - When using HDFS or Cloud Storage,  files once ingested are stored in a sub-directory named after the domain name.
                   - When used with BigQuery, files are ingested and sorted in tables under a dataset named after the domain name.

tags.description: Set of string to attach to this domain

rename.description: If present, the attribute is renamed with this name

database.description: Output Database (refer to a project id in BigQuery). Default to SL_DATABASE env var if set.

name.description: Optional name. If not specified, the name of the file without the extension is used.

items.description: List of transform tasks to execute

default.description: Default task properties to apply to all tasks defined in tasks section and in included files

name.description: Table name. Set to '*' to extract all tables. Scope: Schema and Data extraction.

sql.description: SQL used to extract schema and data. Ignore columns attribute if set.

columns.description: List of columns to extract. All columns by default.

oneOf.description: Column name to extract. Scope: Schema and Data extraction.

name.description: Column name to extract. Scope: Schema and Data extraction.

rename.description: Rename database column name. Scope: Schema and Data extraction.

filter.description: Filter applied along data extraction. Scope: Data extraction

stringPartitionFunc.description: SQL template used on partition column's of type String. Some implementations are already defined, see ai.starlake.extract.JdbcDbUtils.getStringPartitionFunc. Mandatory variables: col, nb_partitions. Scope: Data extraction.

encoding.description: Specifies encoding (charset) of saved CSV files.

withHeader.description: If true, writes the names of columns as the first line.

separator.description: Character used as a separator for each field and value. TODO: check if we are expecting character.

quote.description: Character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value. TODO: check if we are expecting character.

escape.description: Character used for escaping quotes inside an already quoted value. TODO: check if we are expecting character.

nullValue.description: String representation of a null value.

datePattern.description: Java date pattern to apply on date object. Have a look at https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/time/format/DateTimeFormatter.html

timestampPattern.description: Java timestamp pattern to apply on timestamp object. Have a look at https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/time/format/DateTimeFormatter.html

catalog.description: Optional catalog name in the source database. Scope: Schema and Data extraction.

schema.description: Database schema where source tables are located. For mysql use this instead of catalog. Scope: Schema and Data extraction.

tableRemarks.description: Query template used to retrieve table remark. Available variables: catalog, schema, table. Scope: Schema extraction.

columnRemarks.description: Query template used to retrieve all columns' remark of a table. Available variables: catalog, schema, table. Scope: Schema extraction.

tableTypes.description: One or many of the predefined table types. Scope: Schema and Data extraction.

template.description: Template used during schema extraction in order to generate load files (domain and tables). Scope: Schema extraction.

pattern.description: Pattern template used to define load tables' file pattern. Available variables: catalog, schema, table. Scope: Schema extraction.

numericTrim.description: Trim strategies applied to numeric fields set on load table's definition. Scope: Schema extraction.

partitionColumn.description: Column to use in order to parallelize data extraction. Scope: Data extraction.

numPartitions.description: Number of data partitions to create. Scope: Data extraction.

connectionOptions.description: Options to set on data connection. Scope: Data extraction.

fetchSize.description: Number of rows to be fetched from the database when additional rows are needed. By default, most JDBC drivers use a fetch size of 10, so if you are reading 1000 objects, increasing the fetch size to 256 can significantly reduce the time required to fetch the query's results. The optimal fetch size is not always obvious. Scope: Data extraction.

stringPartitionFunc.description: SQL template used on partition column's of type String. Some implementations are already defined, see ai.starlake.extract.JdbcDbUtils.getStringPartitionFunc. Mandatory variables: col, nb_partitions. Scope: Data extraction.

fullExport.description: Define if we should fetch the entire table's or not. If not, maximum value of partitionColumn seen during last extraction is used in order to fetch incremental data. Scope: Data extraction.

sanitizeName.description: Sanitize domain's name by keeping alpha numeric characters only. Scope: Schema and Data extraction.

tables.description: List of tables to extract. Scope: Schema and Data extraction.

exclude.description: List of tables to exclude. Applied on tables list. Scope: Schema and Data extraction.

jdbcSchemas.description: Describe what to fetch from data connection. Scope: Schema and Data extraction.

connectionRef.description: Connection used to retrieve at least data from it. If not defined, fallback to application settings. Expected connection name as defined in the connections section of the application.conf file. Scope: Schema and data extraction.

auditConnectionRef.description: Connection used to read/store audit from it. If not defined, fallbacks to connectionRef. Expected connection name as defined in the connections section of the application.conf file. Scope: Data extraction.

output.description: Override the output format of data extraction. Scope: Data extraction.

default.description: Configuration merged into each jdbcSchemas. Scope: Schema and Data extraction.

database.description: Database pattern to match, none if any database

domain.description: Domain pattern to match, none if any domain match

RefV1.description: Describe how to resolve a reference in a transform task

output.description: The output table resolved with the domain and database

env.description: Default environment to use. May be also set using the SL_ENV environment variable

datasets.description: When using filesystem storage, default path to store the datasets

incoming.description: Incoming folder to use during autoload

dags.description: DAG generation config folder. metadata/dags by default

tests.description: Path to tests folder. Default is ${metadata}/tests

writeStrategies.description: Location where are located user defined write strategies; Default is ${metadata}/write-strategies

metadata.description: default metadata folder name. May be also set using the SL_METADATA environment variable

validateOnLoad.description: Validate the YAML file when loading it. If set to true fails on any error

archive.description: Should ingested files be archived after ingestion ?

sinkReplayToFile.description: Should invalid records be stored in a replay file ?

defaultWriteFormat.description: Default write format in Spark. parquet is the default

defaultRejectedWriteFormat.description: Default write format in Spark for rejected records. parquet is the default

defaultAuditWriteFormat.description: Default write format in Spark for audit records. parquet is the default

csvOutput.description: output files in CSV format ? Default is false

csvOutputExt.description: CSV file extension when csvOutput is true. Default is .csv

privacyOnly.description: Only generate privacy tasks. Reserved for internal use

emptyIsNull.description: Should empty strings be considered as null values ?

loader.description: Default loader to use when none is specified in the schema. Valid values are 'spark' or 'native'. Default is 'spark'

loadStrategyClass.description: In what order should the files for a same table be loaded ? By time (default) or by or name ?

grouped.description: Should we load of the files to be stored in the same table in a single task or one by one ?

groupedMax.description: Maximum number of files to be stored in the same table in a single task

root.description: Root folder for the application. May be also set using the SL_ROOT environment variable

udfs.description: Coma separated list of UDF to register in Spark jobs. May be also set using the SL_UDFS environment variable

sqlParameterPattern.description: Pattern to use to replace parameters in SQL queries in addition to the jinja syntax {{param}}. Default is ${param}

rejectAllOnError.description: Should we reject all records when an error occurs ? Default is false

rejectMaxRecords.description: Maximum number of records to reject when an error occurs. Default is 100

database.description: Default target database (projectId in GCP). May be also set using the SL_DATABASE environment variable

connectionRef.description: Default connection to use when loading / transforming data

schedulePresets.description: Default connection to use when loading / transforming data

maxParTask.description: How many job to run simultaneously in dev mode (experimental)

dagRef.description: Default connection to use when loading / transforming data

forceHalt.description: Force application to stop even when there is some pending thread.
